primary_use_case: Standardize Salesforce monitoring and prevention controls for risky user/API behavior with auditable evidence
top_3_outcomes: Reduce high-risk export incidents by 50%, Detect suspicious API use within 15 minutes, Achieve 100% critical policy coverage in prod
platform_scope: Salesforce first, then ServiceNow and Workday
salesforce_clouds: Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Experience Cloud
guest_users_integrations: Yes - include guest/community users and all API integrations
event_types: login, logout, api, report_export, uri, setup_audit_trail, apex_execution
severity_thresholds: Critical: immediate response; High: 1 hour; Medium: 24 hours; Low: weekly review
tsp_risk_scenarios:
Impossible travel login patterns
High-volume export anomalies
Suspicious API token and integration usage
Privileged admin risky config changes
tsp_actions: Block, challenge, notify, allow with audit
mfa_requirements: MFA required for all interactive and privileged users
session_settings: Session timeout 30 minutes idle, lock on suspicious activity
ip_network_controls: Trusted IP ranges for admin and integration profiles
connected_apps_policy: Connected apps allowlist with least-privilege scopes
data_export_controls: Block or challenge high-risk exports, alert on medium-risk
encryption_masking: Encryption at rest and masking for sensitive fields
data_residency: UK and EU data residency for in-scope business data
escalation_path: Escalate to CorpIS governance and application owner after SLA breach
evidence_format: JSON findings + markdown executive summary + evidence links
additional_frameworks: NIST CSF 2.0, ISO 27001, internal CorpIS policy IDs
control_id_policy: provisional now, strict enterprise IDs by Q3
